title: transactions lost.  removed tx from pool: Nonce too low

body:
continuing from

```
I0430 17:52:45.836181   12631 transaction_pool.go:316] removed tx (9dcd5dcd) from pool: Nonce too low
```

Here's the log:
https://gist.github.com/ethers/2dd9ebc1b6af8453172c

From the log, here's what happened to the previous 2 txs before 9dcd5dcd:

at 17:46:35 d8ed is sent around block 0x34106 and mined at 0x34122.  Took 22 blocks

a010 is sent around block 0x34122 and mined at 0x3414e (not in the log but eth_getTransactionByHash shows the block it belongs to).  Took 44 blocks

9dcd5dcd is sent around block 0x34124 17:52:35 and 10 seconds later gets 

```
I0430 17:52:45.836181   12631 transaction_pool.go:316] removed tx (9dcd5dcd) from pool: Nonce too low
```

Full hashes for above tx are:
0xd8ed387c8ac5b3e2b2bbe886b88fa62f7a6d85239b5a7e401089c7c54b953517
0xa010ece3b329605626b624730ccd9fe46e518ea19501a2a9c8f94bbe20b7c304
0x9dcd5dcd01615aabfc8eb790bfcee6cd443ec6f599651ee72c9d47c69f0d09d6
This happened to me a couple times last night as well using latest Geth
If you received a nonce too low, does it allow you sent another transaction (and does it succeed?)

> If you received a nonce too low, does it allow you sent another transaction (and does it succeed?)

I'm naming "another transaction" tx2, and the one that was lost tx1, because tx2 is dependent on the storage changes that tx1 makes.  Yes, tx2 is sent and yes it gets mined.  But since tx2 depended on the storage that tx1 set, since tx1 was lost, tx2 was not able to set the storage it desired (tx2 took an error path in contract instead).

And such is the danger that comes with dependent transactions. Never, under any circumstances assume that a transaction gets mined, especially if a transaction depends on another.

If you're sending transactions that depend on each other be 100% sure that the transaction goes through. This is something that's up to the **user**.
Could you retest this on the latest develop @ethers

Been running develop 6c2ad7b72ee3d159e1a2439fc16358ceea39118e and also with script improvements, I'm satisfied with the behavior.  (I still see "removed tx from pool: Nonce too low" in the log, but not sure if it is from my transactions, and if it is, script retry behavior is working fine.)
